intro: Dybowskia seretii, commonly known as the Seret's dybowskia, is a rare and unique member of the Apiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
